info.title: Jackrabbit X-Chain Swap
info.description: Jackrabbit uses the Swing API to bridge tokens from Ethereum to Moonbeam via the Axelar Network.

get.description: Compare quote from different bridges and find the best price.

parameters.name: tokenSymbol
parameters.description: Token symbol on the source chain.

parameters.name: toTokenSymbol
parameters.description: Token symbol on the destination chain.

parameters.name: tokenAmount
parameters.description: Token amount in minimal divisible unit (Wei)

parameters.name: fromTokenAddress
parameters.description: Token address on source chain.

parameters.name: fromChain
parameters.description: Source chain slug

parameters.name: fromChainId
parameters.description: Source Chain Id. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0.

parameters.name: toChain
parameters.description: Destination chain slug.

parameters.name: toChainId
parameters.description: Destination Chain Id. In case of non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0

parameters.name: fromUserAddress
parameters.description: User's wallet address from source chain.

parameters.name: slippageTolerance
parameters.description: SlippageTolerance is used by Celer Bridge and it is optional. If not present, we will use default one based on chain and token.

parameters.name: toUserAddress
parameters.description: User's wallet address on the destination chain. This is only required on transfers between EVM and non-EVM chains, e.g. wormhole

parameters.name: toTokenAddress
parameters.description: Token address on the destination chain. This is only required in case of transfer between EVM and non-EVM chains, e.g. wormhole

get.description: Return allowance of a given bridge contract with specific token on source chain

parameters.name: tokenSymbol
parameters.description: Token symbol on the source chain.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: Token address on source chain.

parameters.name: fromChain
parameters.description: Source chain slug

parameters.name: fromChainId
parameters.description: Source Chain Id. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0.

parameters.name: toChain
parameters.description: Dest chain slug. Only required for token swap in Nxtp bridge

parameters.name: toChainId
parameters.description: Dest Chain Id. Only required for token swap in Nxtp bridge

parameters.name: fromAddress
parameters.description: User's wallet address from source chain.

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge slug

get.description: Approve Bridge contract for a specific token on source chain

parameters.name: tokenSymbol
parameters.description: Token symbol on the source chain.

parameters.name: tokenAddress
parameters.description: Token address on source chain.

parameters.name: tokenAmount
parameters.description: Token amount in minimal divisible unit (Wei)

parameters.name: fromChain
parameters.description: Source chain slug

parameters.name: fromChainId
parameters.description: Source Chain Id. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0.

parameters.name: toChain
parameters.description: Dest chain slug. Only required in Across bridge. Optional in Nxtp bridge

parameters.name: toChainId
parameters.description: Dest Chain Id. Only required in Across bridge. Optional in Nxtp bridge

parameters.name: fromAddress
parameters.description: User's wallet address from source chain.

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge slug

post.description: Send transfer request to bridge contract based on the route computed by getQuote api

fromUserAddress.description: User's wallet on source chain. we will use the same wallet address for EVM transfers. For non-EVM transfer, please enter toUserAddress

route.description: Best route returned by Swing /quote endpoint

toTokenAddress.description: Token address on the destination chain. This is only required in case of transfer between EVM and non-EVM chains.

toUserAddress.description: User's wallet address on the destination chain.

fromTokenAccountAddress.description: Solana specific token account address (required if transfer is from Solana to EVM chains)

toTokenAccountAddress.description: Solana specific token account address (required if transfer is from EVM chains to Solana)

slippageTolerance.description: SlippageTolerance is used by Celer Bridge and it is optional. If not present, we will use default one based on chain and token.

maxSlippage.description: Optional value returned by the getQuote endpoint for celer bridge.

encryptionPublicKey.description: Nxtp requires encryptionPublicKey to encrypt callData.

txId.description: Internal unique identifier used by underlying bridge. Not guaranteed to be the transaction hash. For celer this is the transferId.

needClaim.description: If true, need to call /claim endpoint to claim token on the destination chain for this specific transaction.

refundReason.description: only shows if status is in refund state

txStartedTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the Transaction was first initiated

fromTokenAddress.description: Token Address of sending token on the source chain

fromChainId.description: Chain ID of the source chain

fromAmount.description: Initial token amount sent from the source chain

toTokenAddress.description: Token Address of receiving token on the destination chain

toChainId.description: Chain ID of the destination chain

toAmount.description: Final token amount deposited into the destination chain

fromChainTxHash.description: The transaction hash returned from the source chain

toChainTxHash.description: The transaction hash on the destination chain

get.description: Check the transfer status for a given bridge

parameters.name: fromChain
parameters.description: Source chain slug. Optional search filter

parameters.name: fromChainId
parameters.description: Source Chain Id. Optional search filter. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0.

parameters.name: toChain
parameters.description: Destination chain slug. Optional search filter

parameters.name: toChainId
parameters.description: Destination Chain Id. Optional search filter. In case of non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge slug. Optional bridge filter

parameters.name: txId
parameters.description: Bridge-specific transaction identifier. For NXTP this is the transaction id from bid. For celer this is the transferId.

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: user's wallet address on source chain

parameters.name: txHash
parameters.description: Transaction Hash returned by signer (e.g. metamask) on source chain.

txId.description: Internal unique identifier used by underlying bridge. Not guaranteed to be the transaction hash. For celer this is the transferId.

needClaim.description: If true, need to call /claim endpoint to claim token on the destination chain for this specific transaction.

refundReason.description: only shows if status is in refund state

txStartedTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the Transaction was first initiated

fromTokenAddress.description: Token Address of sending token on the source chain

fromChainId.description: Chain ID of the source chain

fromAmount.description: Initial token amount sent from the source chain

toTokenAddress.description: Token Address of receiving token on the destination chain

toChainId.description: Chain ID of the destination chain

toAmount.description: Final token amount deposited into the destination chain

fromChainTxHash.description: The transaction hash returned from the source chain

toChainTxHash.description: The transaction hash on the destination chain

get.description: get the history for a given bridge

parameters.name: fromChainId
parameters.description: Source Chain Id. Optional search filter. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0

parameters.name: toChainId
parameters.description: Destination Chain Id. Optional search filter. In case of non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0

parameters.name: userAddress
parameters.description: user's wallet address on source chain

parameters.name: txId
parameters.description: Transaction hash in most cases. For celer this is the transferId.

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge slug. Optional search filter.

hash.description: hash of the signature that will be the input of the claim function for NXTP

relayerFee.description: relayer fee of the signature that will be the input of the claim function for NXTP

useNativeTokenToClaim.description: This will be used in '/claim' endpoint
Only required if bridge is nxtp cross swap. Default false which will use relayer fee

post.description: [NXTP Only] Genereate signature which is required in the NXTP claim request.

txId.description: Transaction hash genereated by send request

userAddress.description: user's wallet address on destination chain

signature.description: Only required if bridge is nxtp

relayerFee.description: Only required if bridge is nxtp cross swap

useNativeTokenToClaim.description: Only required if bridge is nxtp cross swap. Default false which will use relayer fee

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain Id. Optional search filter. For non-EVM chain like Solana or Terra, put 0.

parameters.name: chain
parameters.description: Chain slug. Optional search filter

parameters.name: bridge
parameters.description: Bridge slug. Optional search filter

post.description: Notify API about the txHash and other relavant data upon sending transaction onchain.

fromChainTxHash.description: TxHash returned by JsonRPC signer on the source chain.

txId.description: Bridge specific transaction id. For example, NXTP is router transaction id and Celer is transfer id.

toUserAddress.description: User's wallet address on the destination chain. Only applicaple if toUserAddress is different (in case of non-EVM chain transfer).

destinationTxFee.description: Fee taken for the destination transfer transaction

TransferStatus.title: TransferStatus
TransferStatus.description:
- `Submitted`: meaning that the token is still on the source chain. The source chain tx is in pending status.
- `Pending Source Chain`: The tx on source chain is done, but the tx doesn’t appear on the dst chain yet. 2a. In case of token transfer, the bridge router is moving assets from source chain to destination chain. 2b. In case of cross-chain swap, this means either our contract is depositing token to the bridge contract or the bridge contract is finished but bridge router is moving assets from source chain to destination chain.n- `Pending Destination Chain`: The tx appears on the destination chain but it is still running.
- `Completed`: Token is delivered to use’s wallet on dest chain yet.
 `Refund Required`: Token is stuck on the bridge and required refund. (e.g. In case of Celer, clients need to call /refund endpoint).
- `Refunded`: Refund is successful. No more action needed.
- `Failed Source Chain`: Transaction failed on the source chain 1a. In case of the token transfer, this means we cannot invoke the bridge contract. The token will be returned back to user’s wallet on the source chain. 1b. In case of the cross-chain swap, this means our contract fails or we failed to invoke the bridge contract. The token will be returned back to the user’s wallet on the source chain.
- `Failed Destination Chain`: Transaction failed on the destination chain. 3a. In case of the token transfer, this shouldn't happen. 3b. In case of the cross-chain swap, this means our contract failed to run and the bridge token was sent to the user’s wallet on the destination chain.
